snippet: A woman with a young child was shot to death after turning her vehicle into a weapon, ramming her way through barriers at the White House and on Capitol Hill.
abstract: Miriam Carey of Stamford, Conn, is shot to death in Washington, DC, after turning her vehicle into a weapon, ramming her way through barriers outside the White House and on Capitol Hill; by time ensuing chase ended, dozens of shots had been fired and two officers were injured; toddler in the car during incident is retrieved unharmed; officials say Carey was unarmed.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Emmarie Huetteman, Ashley Parker, Alicia Parlapiano, Jeremy W. Peters, Ashley Southall and Jonathan Weisman in Washington; William K. Rashbaum, Nate Schweber and Ravi Somaiya in New York; and Kristin Hussey in Stamford, Conn. Susan Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A woman with a young child was shot to death after turning her vehicle into a weapon, ramming her way through barriers at the White House and on Capitol Hill.

headline.main: Car Chase, White House to Capitol, Has Fatal End
headline.print_headline: Car Chase, White House To Capitol, Has Fatal End
